    console.log(num); // è¾“å‡º: undefined

2. let

function testLet() {
    // console.log(count); // æŠ¥é”™: ReferenceError: Cannot access 'count' before initialization
    let count = 10;
    console.log(count); // è¾“å‡º: 10
    // let count = 20; // æŠ¥é”™: SyntaxError: Identifier 'count' has already been declared
    if (true) {
        let innerCount = 20;
        console.log(innerCount); // è¾“å‡º: 20
    }
    // console.log(innerCount); // æŠ¥é”™: ReferenceError: innerCount is not defined
}

function testConst() {
    // const PI; // æŠ¥é”™: SyntaxError: Missing initializer in const declaration
    const PI = 3.14;
    // PI = 3.14159; // æŠ¥é”™: TypeError: Assignment to constant variable.
    console.log(PI); // è¾“å‡º: 3.14

    const person = { name: 'Alice' };
    person.name = 'Bob'; // å¯ä»¥ä¿®æ”¹å¯¹è±¡çš„å±æ€§
    console.log(person.name); // è¾“å‡º: Bob
}
